original: Hahn, Bengt Conrad, stadsläkare, Linköping, f. 28/5/Oil i Motaila av provrläk. Rudolf H. o. Emmy Westlin. G. 29 m. Ruth Hemberg. Barn: Bengt-Rudolf f. 30, Birgitta 32, Lennart 38. — Stud:ex. i Sundsvall 19, med. kand. i Upps. 24 o. med. lic. där 27. Studires. t. olika tyska univ. fysiolog. in,st. 22. Aman. v. fyisiolog. inst. i Upps. 22-23, assist :läk. v. Ny-köp. las., tf. aman. v. Akad. sjukh. med. poliklin. samt e. iläk. v. Upps. hosp. o. asyil 28, und :läk. v. ÖiSter-åsens sanat. 29’-30, assist :läk. o. tf. andre läk. v. Sahlgr. sjukh. med. avd. satot tf. und :iliäk. v. Borås (las. m-ed. avd. o. Fagereds sanat. 30, e. läk. o. tf. andre und:läk. v. Sundsvalls las. med. avd. 31, und :läk. v. Lidköp. las. med. avd. 31-34, v. Mailmö epid:sjukh. 34-35, stadsdistr :läk. i Gävle 35, bitr. dis-pensärläk., iläk. v. dövstumsk., bitr. förste provrläk. i Gävleb. 1. 44, stads-läk. i Linköp. sed. 46. Under Gävle-tiden led. av nykterhindn, länsnyk-terhindn, v. ordf. i Gävle Röda korskrets. Ämb :man i Frimurarorden. Skr.: über die Einwirkung voin Ho-denextrakten auf den Kreislauf des Blutes (i Skandinav. Archiv für Phy-sioilogie 24).
translated: Hahn, Bengt Conrad, city physician, Linköping, b. May 28, 1901, in Motaila, son of chief physician Rudolf H. and Emmy Westlin. Married in 1929 to Ruth Hemberg, they have three children: Bengt-Rudolf b. 1930, Birgitta b. 1932, and Lennart b. 1938. He attended high school in Sundsvall in 1919, graduated with a degree in medicine from Uppsala University in 1924, and obtained a medical license in 1927. He studied at various German universities for physiological research in 1922. He was an assistant at the Department of Physiology in Uppsala from 1922-1923, assistant physician at Nyköping Hospital, acting assistant at the Medical Polyclinic and medical intern at Uppsala Hospital and Asylum in 1928. He was an assistant physician and acting second physician at Sahlgr. Hospital medical department, temporary intern at Borås Hospital medical department and Fagered Sanatorium in 1930, medical intern and acting second medical intern at Sundsvall Hospital medical department in 1931, medical intern at Lidköping Hospital medical department from 1931-1934, at Mailmö Epidemic Hospital from 1934-1935, city district physician in Gävle in 1935, deputy dispensary physician, medical doctor for the deaf and dumb, deputy chief physician in Gävleb. starting in 1944, city physician in Linköping since 1946. During his time in Gävle he was involved with temperance movements and served as vice chairman of the Gävle Red Cross district. He was also a member of the Freemason Order. He wrote about the effect of testicular extract on blood circulation in the Scandinavian Archives of Physiology vol. 24.
